byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Rep Trey Gowdy, chairman of committee investigating 2012 attack in Benghazi, has been working to defend credibility of committee and bolster his own standing in advance of hearing testimony from Hillary Rodham Clinton; Gowdy and other committee members have made series of errors that have raised questions about whether committee is less interested in investigation than it is in hurting Clinton's presidential prospects.
lead_paragraph: Trey Gowdy, head of the House committee looking into the 2012 attack in Benghazi, Libya, is struggling to uphold his panel’s credibility and his own standing.

headline.main: Benghazi Panel’s Leader Under Fire as He Prepares to Face Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Benghazi Panel’s Leader Is Under Fire as He Prepares to Question Clinton

snippet: Trey Gowdy, head of the House committee looking into the 2012 attack in Benghazi, Libya, is struggling to uphold his panel’s credibility and his own standing.
